page.title: 02IMPACT OF OIL ON DYCE
page.content: When we surveyed a hundred pupils and staff at random in Dyce Academy, we found that sixty-six of the hundred had a close relative who worked in an {oil related industry. Most of them had {moved to Dyce to find work. Half of the pupils thought they were better off since their parents had got a job in the oil business. Twenty-six people out of the sixty-six said they had a{large house},a bigger percentage than people with small or medium sized houses. Jobs in oil were thought to be the reason why so many families had large houses. Most of their relatives worked in a manual job, only a few in clerical jobs. The survey shows how the oil industry has made Dyce more{affluent}since 1975.
